The course is very useful. I learned systematic categorical data analysis which will definitely help me in my future work. I think more models and model selection methods could be included.

Strengths: professor teach lecture very clearly and patiently. 
Weakness: professor does not cover many chapters in the book.
May be professor could cover more chapters in the book.

The course progresses very slowly and recapitulates much of what students have taken- linear regression, odds ratios/rel risk/risk ratio, confidence intervals, etc. These are covered in intro biostats, intro epi, and BIS 621/623 which are prereqs. The examples are taken from the book, so there is little advantage to attending class. There are few slides-- many times the professor starts writing on the board and it's unclear if this is to improve understanding or if there is a derivation that is an important point that is NOT in the slides. I took this class to get deeper into logistic regression and feel that I did not accomplish that goal given the slow pace of the first 2/3 of the class.
Great!
good
This is a basic course for categorical data analysis, and it's taught in a very detailed way. So it's very friendly for those who are beginners.

strength: nice elaboration on details
weakness: needs to steer to application more or theory more
good class
Course materials are a little easy and unstructured.  Maybe more explanation and guidance of final project in class would be better.
Some basic knowledge takes too much time.
Strength: Build up systematic statistical thinking skill for us. Let us to develope project on our own.

This class appear to be an intro-level class. The instructor can make this class more challenging. She spent a lot of time on very basic content, which makes the class boring. I would suggest the instructor moves to more advanced topic, which can be much more useful.
I think we've learned most of the topics in other courses already; it would be nice to cover some more advanced topics.
I think the discussion session could be more efficient
A superficial coverage of categorical data analysis
We should be given more practical projects to work on instead of just problem sets on the textbook.
The class provides student in-depth knowledge to deal with categorical data.
thorough lecture slides, good teaching materials
Good. Knowledge learned in this class is useful.
Its a good course. The course is well-organized and instructions are clear.
The course gives a good introduction to categorical data analysis. The final project gives a good opportunity to review all the important concepts learned throughout the semester.
Great course!
Make solution guides for problem sets.  Maybe go a little faster in going over the materials?
Great material, but the lectures were very dry and slow. The slideshows and textbook were very helpful for learning the material, and the final project was a great data analysis experience.
The instructor teaches really slow and sometimes can't explain things intuitively.
GOOD
Useful class
good
The course was well structured and organised. It would be more helpful if more applied side of analysis could be demonstrated in class.
She is a good instructor, the slides are very clear.

Strengths: explain everything clearly and patiently. 
Weakness: the speed of class is slow. 
professor can cover more materials in a class.

Very slow pace of class that went over material covered in several other classes (see above). Examples from her research or from actual published literature (not from textbook) would be beneficial. Also, if there is material not covered in slides that students should know very well this should be explicitly stated when there are blackboard/whiteboard notes.
She was a great instructor. She always explained definitions clearly. I really love the examples in class, which could help me better understand the concepts and models.
good

I really appreciate it when Dr. Wang wrote down some equations on the white board to help us understand. I think sometimes the pace of teaching was a little bit slow. It might be better if the first two lectures were taught faster, because they are very basic and easy to understand.
Nice professor
Not understanding what she is talking about. Bad speaking skill
the instructor is very nice,
Prof. Wang gives a clear analysis of teaching materials, but maybe allocate more time on more difficult stuff.
Actually, the instructor can give a good lecture if she could prepare it well... The instructor knows the content well, but sometimes she may have difficulties explaining them.
She is very nice and professional.
The teaching slides are very organized and easy to understand.
Could be a little bit better in organizing the course and expanding the depth of this course
She's intelligent and patient....just needs to improve her oral English a little bit.
Professor Wang is really good at making nice slides. The slides are succinct yet informative, which are very helpful!
Maybe consider control the pace of the course, more concise?
Overall is very good. I think it would be better if  raising voice a little bit or using microphone.
Professor Wang is very helpful and explains concepts very clearly.
The instructor explains the concepts and theories very clearly.
Professor Wang was very helpful during office hours. Her lecture notes were very clear and detailed. Overall a great instructor!
Excellent.  Very soft-spoken.   But really nice and extremely knowledgable if you speak to her in person.
Very nice but a very dry lecturer
May consider to speed up teaching and cover more materials in class.
louder voice
Very helpful and nice instructor. Clear PPT. Reasonable workload.
good
The content is very clear and useful. She could be more confident in her teaching. It was very nice of her to take appointment for every student to discuss about the final projects.
This course introduces skills to deal with categorical data, I would recommend to others.
This course is helpful for providing basic knowledge on categorical data analysis. It is useful for completing a research. Yes, because this course is really useful and functional.
This class was slow paced and added little to what other courses (AAMIE, BIS621/623, BIS630) and did not add significantly to my ability to analyze categorical data.
I highly recommend this course to beginners of categorical data analysis or those who have little experience with data analysis.
good
A course suitable for beginners in categorical data analysis. Yes, I would recommend it.
This course is very basic. I would suggest PhD students to go for more advanced class.
It's a good general course!

Not recommended if you come from a stats or math background
Highly repeated with previous introductory stats course (on the easy part)
I recommend it to any student who wants to learn more about categorical data analysis.
The course materials and text book are most helpful for studying this course.
Recommend! Learnt a lot of useful stuff in this course.
I will recommend, because knowledge is useful.
I would recommend the class because it is very useful when applying solve the real-world questions.
This class offers the skillsets that are very helpful for a future statistician. I recommend this class to another student.
Highly recommend to another student interested in learning techniques to analyze categorical data.
great intro to glms.  wished it went faster.
Great material, but the lectures were very dry and slow. The slideshows and textbook were very helpful for learning the material, and the final project was a great data analysis experience.
feel that i could learn much more if more topics could be covered in class.
good
Good class. Would recommend.
good
Good course that could add project experience and overall ability of handling categorical data.
